elements.title: Unisphere (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the Unisphere (pictured) was designed based on a doodle on the back of an envelope?

elements.title: Luca Comai (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that plant biology professor Luca Comai independently developed glyphosate-resistant plants while working at Calgene and published his research before Monsanto researchers were able to?

elements.title: Zollstock (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Zollstock, a district of Cologne, takes its name from a local tollhouse?

elements.title: Bridget Burgess (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Bridget Burgess's mother Sarah once changed all four tires during a pit stop by herself?

elements.title: Never Stop (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Zheng Kai first lost weight and then gained 20 kilograms (44 lb) for his role in Never Stop?

elements.title: Francis Burt (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the composer Francis Burt, who came from London and settled in Vienna, was inspired by the drumming of the Nigerian Ibo people?

elements.title: WKY-TV (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that in 1952 meteorologist Harry Volkman delivered the first on-air tornado warning on Oklahoma City's WKY-TV, in defiance of a federal ban on the practice?

elements.title: Pierre Kaufmann (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Pierre Kaufmann helped install the first radio telescope in Brazil, which was later destroyed by cows?
